entries.title: The Apothecary Diaries 2nd Season
entries.review: From ghost stories and bug obsession to color blindness—every odd piece from earlier episodes, and everything else we've seen so far, was part of this devastating build-up. The storyline involving western bloodlines, nobles, and royalty ran so deep, it was overwhelming. I'm sorry—I'm at a loss for words. But what I can say is, it was so profound, so powerful, so heartbreaking... it brought me to tears. Absolutely stunning...

entries.title: The Catcher in the Ballpark!
entries.review: Simply a perfect episode. Every part was tightly woven together—even with episodes from the past—and the emotional payoff was overwhelming. While keeping its light-hearted charm, all three segments truly hit home. The Kojiro and Tsubaki story? Cheat-level excellence. (Tsubaki and Sanshiro, by the way, are classically linked names in Japanese pop culture—think Tsubaki Sanjuro.) Who could watch that arc without tearing up? And the ending? That special ED song and animation crafted specifically for this episode—too much. It paired so perfectly with everything we’d just seen. Sorry, I can’t even see the screen anymore...

entries.title: Sword of the Demon Hunter
entries.review:
I didn’t expect the transition from Edo to Heisei to hit this hard—it was subtle, but so cleverly done it caught me off guard. The play, written by Yotaka (yep, the prostitute from the Edo arc), nailed the essence of the story and its characters. And the fact that the Heisei students were watching it, commenting on it—cracking up over how uncool Jinya’s role was—just made it all land even harder.
There was this quiet sense of nostalgia layered under the humor, like you’re laughing but also feeling the weight of everything that’s been lost. And the way they used traditional theater pacing and structure? Absolutely nailed it. It was tight, emotional, and totally immersive. No question—solid 10

entries.title: Mobile Suit Gundam GQuuuuuuX
entries.review: Wow… Elmes. A vessel of timeless, transcendental beauty — serene, sacred, and strangely universal… no — multi-universal — which stretches across dimensions.This isn’t something that can or should be evaluated by the same standards as other shows this season.It was a brilliant and enigmatic encounter — a true Meguriai Sora moment.

entries.title: From Old Country Bumpkin to Master Swordsman
